item.title: Can Data Science make me a better angler? Part 2
item.author: aurelien.callens@gmail.com (Aurelien Callens)
item.description: In the previous blog article, I described in details how I built a shiny application that stores data about my fishing sessions. In this post, I will explore the data I have collected during the last year. To sum up, my application store the data in two csv files. The first one contains variables related to the fishing conditions at the beginning and at the end of the session :

item.title: Can Data Science make me a better angler? Part 1
item.author: aurelien.callens@gmail.com (Aurelien Callens)
item.description: My favorite hobby, in addition to R coding of course, is fishing. Most of the time, I am fishing European sea bass (Dicentrarchus labrax) in estuaries. The sea bass is a predatory fish that has a broad range of preys: crabs, sand eels, prawns, shrimps and other fish. To catch these predators, I don’t use live baits, I prefer to use artificial lures that imitate a specific prey. In theory, it is quite easy to catch a fish:

item.title: What do I do here ?
item.author: aurelien.callens@gmail.com (Aurelien Callens)
item.description: Here, I will present my projects and write articles on different subjects such as : Statistcal analysis Data visualisation Shiny applications Web scrapping etc … All these articles will include R code and examples. Python users won’t be left aside as I am currently learning this language !

item.title: Research
item.author: aurelien.callens@gmail.com (Aurelien Callens)
item.description: My publications Callens, A., Morichon, D., Abadie, S., Delpey, M., Liquet, B. (2020). Using Random forest and Gradient boosting trees to improve wave forecast at a specific location. Applied Ocean Research, 104. doi.org/10.1016/j.apor.2020.102339 Callens, A., Wang, Y., Fu, L. et al. (2020). Robust Estimation Procedure for Autoregressive Models with Heterogeneity. Environmental Modeling & Assessment. doi.org/10.1007/s10666-020-09730-w Morichon, D.

item.title: Who am I ?
item.author: aurelien.callens@gmail.com (Aurelien Callens)
item.description: My name is Aurélien Callens and I am a PhD Student in the Laboratory of Mathematics and its Applications of the University of Pau and Pays de l’Adour (South west of France). I am working to improve predictions of coastal hazards by doing statistical modelling. Education PhD. Statistics, University of Pau and Pays de l’Adour, 2018-Now. Master of Science in Aquatic ecosystem dynamics, University of Pau and Pays de l’Adour, 2016-2018.
